write.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to produce a new book, article, poem etc
write.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He wrote some very famous books.
I can’t come with you – I have an essay to write.
The article is very well written.
O'Brien often writes about her native Ireland.
write.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: someone who writes earns money by writing books, plays, articles etc
write.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Sean decided he wanted to write, and quit his job.
Maureen Dowd writes for ‘The New York Times’.
write.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to put words in a letter to someone
write.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I wrote her several letters, but she didn’t reply.
I’ve written to my MP, and to the city council.
Chris hasn’t written me for a long time.
write.translation[0].definitions[2].note: She writes to me every month
In American English, you can also write someone
You write someone a letter, note, story etc
Please write me a letter soon
Please write to me a letter soon
You write to someone about a subject or an experience
He wrote to me about his trip to France
He wrote to me his trip to France
Write is often used in the progressive
I am writing to tell you something important
write.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to form letters or numbers with a pen or pencil
write.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Kerry could read and write when she was five.
write.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to state something in a book, letter, advertisement etc, or on a label
write.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Isabella wrote that she was dying, and asked him to visit her for the last time.
The price is written on the label.
write.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to write a piece of music or a song
write.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The song was originally written by Leonard Cohen.
write.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to make a program for a computer to use
write.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: He writes software programs for financial institutions.
write.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: if a computer writes something, it records it on a disk or in its memory
write.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: data that had been written to disk
write.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: to write information on a cheque, form etc
write.translation[0].definitions[8].exam: Wouldn’t it be easier if I just wrote a cheque for the lot?
The doctor wrote me a prescription for sleeping pills.
write.translation[0].definitions[9].defi: if a pen writes, it works properly
write.translation[0].definitions[9].exam: Do any of these pens write?
write.translation[0].note_box[0].section: write
to use a pen or pencil to make words, letters etc
Have you written a shopping list?
The children are learning to read and write.
write something down
to write something on paper, in order to remember it or make a record
He wrote down everything she said.
to write something in a particular place, or to write particular words
I’ve put the dates of the meetings in my diary.
At the end of the email she put ‘PS I love you’.
put something in writing
to write something that you have agreed or promised, so that there is an official record
They said they would pay me 50%, but they haven’t actually put it in writing.
make a note of something
to write information that you might need later
I’ll just make a note of your address.
Make a note in your diary.
take notes
to write things while someone is speaking or while something is happening, so that you can use them later
His lawyer was with him taking notes.
scrawl
to write something carelessly and untidily, especially in big letters – often used to show disapproval
Someone had scrawled graffiti on the school wall.
He’d scrawled a few unhelpful comments at the bottom of my work.
fill something in/out
to write information on a form or other official document
Please fill in the application form in black ink.
Would you mind filling out a questionnaire?
sign
to write your name at the end of a letter, document etc
Read the contract carefully, and then sign it.
Don’t forget to sign your name.
to write something quickly
jot something down
to write something very quickly
Start your essay by jotting down a few ideas.
He checked the meter and jotted something down.
scribble
to write something quickly and in an untidy way
Andy scribbled a quick note and handed it to the chairman.
I’ve scribbled something here but I can’t read it now.
to write something on a computer
to make words or numbers appear on a computer screen by pressing the keys
You have to enter your password twice.
The patients medical records are entered into a database.
key something in/type something in
to write or record information on a computer, especially something you are copying
I’ve keyed in my credit card details.
To visit our website, just type in our address.

write.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to sell a particular amount of insurance
write.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: We have written £5 million of insurance this month.
